intro: Eurya tigang var. meizophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf eurya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically narrow and have a leathery texture. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by small, hard berries. This variant is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
